paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Endemic in some areas of Portugal, Japan, and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val30Met mutation mainly affects the peripheral and autonomous nervous systems.
The disease is endemic in some areas of Portugal, Japan and Sweden.
Substantial differences in disease penetrance, age of onset (early or late onset) and other biochemical and clinical features exist among these geographic areas.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation destabilizes the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.population_frequency: Approximately 4% of individuals in endemic regions.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and biochemical studies.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is one of the most studied variants in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The Val30Met mutation mainly affects the peripheral and autonomous nervous systems.
Substantial differences in disease penetrance, age of onset (early or late onset) and other biochemical and clinical features exist among these geographic areas.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val122Ile TTR mutation can lead to late-onset restrictive amyloid cardiomyopathy.
The Val122Ile mutation is present in approximately 4% of African Americans.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation destabilizes TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid formation primarily in the heart.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in African American populations.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical and epidemiological studies.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is a significant cause of late-onset cardiac amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile TTR mutation can lead to late-onset restrictive amyloid cardiomyopathy.
The Val122Ile mutation is present in approximately 4% of African Americans.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
